summary: Federal and state Medicaid spending on behavioral health services—mental health and substance use treatments—is projected to be $71 billion in 2017. However, some adults on Medicaid may have limited access to inpatient or residential behavioral health care because Medicaid generally doesn't cover services for adults in institutions for mental disease. Officials in the 6 states we reviewed tried an average of 2 to 4 strategies...
title: Medicaid: States Fund Services for Adults in Institutions for Mental Disease Using a Variety of Strategies
